docs.lead_paragraph: ALLEGED FRAUDULENT OPERATION IN MERCER-STREET, IN THE FURNITURE LINE.-Yesterday forenoon, a female by the name of Miss BERTHA JURATZIK, appeared at the Second District Police Court, and preferred before Judge STUART a charge of false pretences against a real estate agent and furnisher of houses, whom she alleged has defrauded her out of several hundred dollars.

headline.main: Tribute to Ex-President Fillmore.; Letter to President Fillmore.

docs.lead_paragraph: SIR: As our connection with you is about to terminate, we cannot forbear to give utterance to the feelings of unmingled satisfaction with which we look upon our official and personal intercourse. We have witnessed with admiration, your untiring devotion to the public service, and your patience and assiduity in the discharge of the incessant and laborious duties of your office.
docs.abstract: Tribute from the Member of his Cabinet

byline.original: The National Intelligencer publishes the following complimentary correspondence, which has passed between the Ex-President and the members of his Cabinet:

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. BENNETT reported, by bill, in relation to the abondonment of certain parts of the Great Western Turnpike Company. Mr. BRISTOL, by bill, favorably on the law to amend the act concerning the preservation of health. Mr. BEEKMAN, complete, the Union Cemetery bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thomas Connor, a very young man was on the first inst. sentenced to be hung in Baltimore, for the murder of Capt. William Hutchinson, on the 31st of October last. The Baltimore Sun gives the following account of the effect the sentence produced upon the prisoner: During the pronouncing of the sentence.

headline.main: Later from Havana--The Health of Vice-President King.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Black Warrior, Capt. SHUFELDT, arrived at Mobile at 7 o'clock on Sunday morning, having left Havana on the evening of the 3d inst. A dispatch from Matanzas says that Mr. KING'S health has slightly improved-the climate being more congenial to him. His situation is nevertheless still considered very precarious.

docs.lead_paragraph: A correspondent, whose letter will be found on another page, takes exceptions to a brief notice we made, a while since, of the petitions presented to the United States Senate for the abolition of the tax of twenty cents on seamen's wages as Hospital money.

docs.lead_paragraph: The people of Tampico and the military have pronounced for SANTA ANNA. The citizens resist the Government's proposition to restore the old tariff of duties....By an arrival at Providence, we have news from South Africa to the 4th of January. The British, in a severe fight had, with 1,000 men, routed 6,000 armed Basuto horsemen. The British loss was 38 killed, and near half as many wounded.

docs.lead_paragraph: The last English papers announce the decease of a number of distinguished personages. On the 11th ult., Major General ALLAN, C. B., died at his residence in Lansdown. Gon. ALLAN was first commissioned on the 31st December, 1794, and received the rank of Major General, Nov. 9, 1846.

docs.lead_paragraph: SUDDEN DEATH.--A young man residing in North Fourth-street, died suddenly about 4 o'clock on Sunday morning. It seems that he had been intoxicated on Wednesday morning, and although apparently in the enjoyment of good health, had been unable to sleep up to the time of his death. This should serve as another warning to drinkers.
